info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 12:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Mecklenburg and northwestern Union Counties through 115 PM EDT... At 1246 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northwest of Monroe, or near Indian Trail, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Matthews, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Wesley Chapel, Lake Park, and Hemby Bridge. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized nuisance flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
